Description.value: A capability model based on ITIL V3

systems.Description: Defines the overall strategy and direction for IT services to align with business objectives.
Develops and maintains the IT service strategy to ensure alignment with business goals.
Creates strategies for IT services that support the organization's objectives.

systems.TEXT: 1.1.2. Align IT Strategy with Business Goals
systems.Description: Ensures IT strategies are in sync with the overall business goals and objectives.
Conducts market analysis to manage and optimize the service portfolio.
Manages the complete lifecycle of all IT services.
Oversees the service portfolio to ensure it meets current and future business needs.
Manages the lifecycle of services from inception to retirement.
Handles the budgeting, accounting, and charging requirements for IT services.
Manages the financial aspects of IT services to ensure cost-effectiveness.
Plans and controls the budget for IT services.
Identifies and implements cost-saving measures without compromising service quality.
Generates financial reports related to IT service expenditures and revenues.
Manages and forecasts the demand for IT services to ensure adequate capacity.
Predicts future demand for IT services based on trends and business needs.
Ensures that IT services have sufficient capacity to meet current and future demands.
Controls and manages the demand for IT services to balance supply and demand.
Maintains and enhances relationships with business stakeholders.
Engages with stakeholders to understand their needs and expectations.
Defines and manages SLAs to ensure service quality and performance.
Gathers and analyzes customer feedback to improve IT services.
Designs IT services, architectures, and processes to meet current and future business requirements.
Coordinates all service design activities.
Manages projects related to the design of IT services.
Establishes standards and guidelines for service design.
Ensures seamless integration of various design processes.
Manages the service catalog to provide clear information about available IT services.
Creates and maintains the service catalog with detailed service descriptions.
Ensures that all service listings are up-to-date and accurate.
Provides comprehensive documentation for each service.
Ensures that all IT services meet agreed-upon service levels.
Establishes SLAs that specify service expectations and metrics.
Tracks and ensures compliance with SLAs.
Generates reports on service performance against SLAs.
Ensures IT services have adequate capacity to meet demand.
Plans for future capacity needs based on demand forecasts.
Monitors the performance of IT services to ensure they meet required standards.
Optimizes the use of resources to improve efficiency and performance.
Ensures IT services are available as agreed.
Plans for maintaining and improving service availability.
Continuously monitors service availability and performance.
Develops and maintains plans to recover IT services in case of disasters.
Ensures that IT services can continue during and after a major disruption.
Assesses the impact of disruptions on business operations.
Develops plans to maintain IT service continuity.
Tests and validates continuity plans to ensure effectiveness.
Protects information assets through effective security measures.
Identifies and manages security risks.
Develops and maintains security policies.
Manages security incidents to minimize impact.
Manages relationships with external suppliers.
Selects and evaluates suppliers based on performance and reliability.
Manages supplier contracts to ensure compliance and performance.
Monitors and assesses supplier performance against agreements.
Manages the transition of new or changed services into the live environment.
Plans and supports service transitions.
Develops strategies for effective service transitions.
Allocates resources necessary for service transitions.
Identifies and manages risks associated with service transitions.
Controls the lifecycle of all changes.
Processes and manages change requests.
Assesses and approves changes based on impact and risk.
Implements approved changes and reviews their outcomes.
Manages service assets and configuration items.
Identifies and records configuration items.
Controls changes to configuration items to maintain integrity.
Maintains records of configuration item statuses and histories.
Plans and manages the release of new or changed services.
Plans the release of new or updated services.
Executes the deployment of releases into the live environment.
Validates and tests releases to ensure they meet requirements.
Ensures that new or changed services meet specifications.
Develops plans for testing services.
Executes tests to validate service functionality and performance.
Manages and resolves defects identified during testing.
Evaluates changes to ensure they achieve desired outcomes.
Reviews changes after implementation to assess success and lessons learned.
Analyzes the impact of changes on services and operations.
Continuously improves the change management process based on feedback.
Manages knowledge to support IT services.
Maintains a repository of knowledge articles and information.
Facilitates the sharing and dissemination of knowledge across the organization.
Monitors the use of knowledge to ensure it is effectively applied.
Manages the day-to-day operation of IT services.
Manages events throughout their lifecycle.
Identifies and detects events that occur within IT services.
Filters events to determine their significance and necessary response.
Responds to events to ensure minimal impact on services.
Manages the lifecycle of incidents to restore normal service operation.
Detects and logs incidents as they occur.
Classifies and prioritizes incidents based on their impact and urgency.
Resolves and recovers from incidents to restore services.
Handles service requests from users.
Processes and fulfills user service requests.
Routes service requests to the appropriate fulfillment teams.
Closes service requests after fulfillment.
Manages the lifecycle of problems to prevent incidents.
Detects and logs problems within IT services.
Investigates and diagnoses the root causes of problems.
Resolves problems and closes them once resolved.
Manages user access to IT services.
Processes and handles access requests from users.
Authorizes user access based on policies and roles.
Reviews and audits user access to ensure compliance.
Acts as the single point of contact for users.
Provides support and assistance to users for IT services.
Logs and tracks incidents reported by users.
Manages communication with users regarding incidents and requests.
Provides technical expertise and support.
Offers technical support services to maintain IT infrastructure.
Manages technical knowledge to support IT operations.
Creates and maintains technical documentation for IT services.
Manages day-to-day IT operations.
Monitors IT systems to ensure they are functioning correctly.
Automates and schedules IT operational tasks.
Generates reports on IT operations performance and activities.
Manages applications throughout their lifecycle.
Provides support for applications to ensure they meet user needs.
Coordinates the development and enhancement of applications.
Manages the entire lifecycle of applications from development to retirement.
Continuously improves IT services and processes.
Identifies and implements improvements to IT services.
Identifies areas where IT services can be improved.
Executes initiatives to enhance IT services and processes.
Measures the outcomes of improvement initiatives to assess their effectiveness.
Measures and reports on IT service performance.
Defines key metrics and performance indicators for IT services.
Collects and analyzes data to evaluate service performance.
Creates reports and dashboards to communicate service performance.
Evaluates IT processes to ensure they are effective and efficient.
Assesses the performance of IT processes against standards.
Identifies gaps between current and desired process performance.
Optimizes IT processes to improve efficiency and effectiveness.
Manages and improves service levels.
Regularly reviews SLAs to ensure they remain relevant and effective.
Monitors performance against SLAs to ensure compliance.
Identifies and implements improvements to SLAs based on performance data and feedback.

interactions.To: 1.1.2. Align IT Strategy with Business Goals
